Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. Five line Kufic inscription. Fragment of rim attached. Fragmentary stamp; only right half survives. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4053. From the same die: Miles, G.C. 1958. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ I. New York, 92; Miles, G.C. 1963. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ II (I. Benaki Museum). New York, 25; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York., 266.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (154)
Condition: Fragmentary stamp; only right half survives.
Associated names: Named in inscription: 'Abd al-Malik b. Marwān
